author: seunlanlege
content: Good day sirs, I had a question about casper ffg attestations

author: seunlanlege
content:
Is it the case that an attestation (https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/phase0/beacon-chain.md#attestation) has to have super majority participation from the committee before it's included in a beacon block or it can be included at any participation levels?

The spec doesn't actually prescribe an approach to this

author: m.kalinin
content: There is no such requirement in the spec, the way honest validator should include attestations is described in the following section https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/phase0/validator.md#attestations

author: seunlanlege
content: So is it safe to assume that attestation aggregations will not overlap ðŸ¤”, ie multiple aggregations with participation from a single validator

author: m.kalinin
content: There can be overlaps in aggregates between attestations of a single or multiple blocks. In this case proposers won't receive rewards for inclusion of duplicates, but such aggregates will be processed as usual

author: seunlanlege
content: Ahh thanks for this, wouldn't it be more efficient to have aggregates have supermajority participations before being included on-chain?

author: m.kalinin
content: the chain would have to accommodate tons of attestations once a certain level of participation is reached leading to bursts in block space utilisation, while today block attestation space is utilised uniformly

author: seunlanlege
content: hmm, it's also wasted a bit

author: seunlanlege
content: Can we consider an approach where on-chain attestations need super majority and as a result MAX_ATTESTATIONS is a lower value

author: jgm
content: Every attestation with additional information adds to the security of the chain, not sure that we'd want to restrict it arbitrarily in this way.

author: seunlanlege
content:
> Every attestation with additional information adds to the security of the chain

how so?

author: jgm
content: It increases the number of overall attestations, including the epoch votes (source/target).

author: seunlanlege
content: yes but how does this increase the security? Sorry if i'm asking too many questions i'm just trying to understand the rationale here

author: seunlanlege
content: My assumption is security ultimately falls to supermajority

author: m.kalinin
content: Each attestation carries FFG and LMD votes, LMD is the fork choice rule which defines the current head of the chain. It is very important that information defining the head is included on chain as soon as it's possible
